comments.content:
Per the answer provided URL https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.1/Admin/MoreaboutSplunkFree
How do I get Splunk Enterprise with the Free license?
Create your user account on splunk.com.
Review the list of supported operating systems for the "Free" license in Supported Operating Systems.
Download the latest version of Splunk Enterprise for your operating system from Free Trials and Downloads on splunk.com. Login required.
Use the installation instructions for your operating system. See Installation instructions.
After installation, you'll have an Enterprise Trial license for 60 days. You can change to the Free license at any point before the Enterprise Trial is complete. See Switching to Free from an Enterprise Trial license.

discussion.content:
Answer - B
Comes with product; Valid for 60 days, after which another license type must be activated
Page 42 Splunk Enterprise System Administration

questions.question_text: After an Enterprise Trial license expires, it will automatically convert to a Free license. How many days is an Enterprise Trial license valid before this conversion occurs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D.
User authorization
All authorization for a distributed search originates from the search head. At the time it sends the search request to its search peers, the search head also distributes the authorization information. It tells the search peers the name of the user running the search, the user's role, and the location of the distributed authorize.conf file containing the authorization information.
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.3/DistSearch/Knowledgebundlereplication
I thought it was a dedicated Indexer, but that's incorrect, it's definitely another search head since the key word is dedicated knowledge objects, so its search heads.

D - Search Head ist correct.
Sys Admin Slide 199
B. The Deployment Server will distribute the configurations to the machines that will prevent access to those reports and Knowledge Objects

questions.question_text: Consider a company with a Splunk distributed environment in production. The Compliance Department wants to start using Splunk; however, they want to ensure that no one can see their reports or any other knowledge objects. Which Splunk Component can be added to implement this policy for the new team?

comments.content:
Using Splunk docs, specifically the reference URL https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.2/Updating/Deploymentserverarchitecture
"A deployment client is a Splunk instance remotely configured by a deployment server".
Not A, it says local instances.

discussion.content: Ans is A. P91 Data admin. 'Built-in tool for centrally managing configuration packages as apps for clients'

choices.A: Allows management of local Splunk instances, requires Enterprise license, handles job of sending configurations packaged as apps, can automatically restart remote Splunk instances.
choices.D: Allows management of remote Splunk instances, requires Enterprise license, handles job of sending configurations, can manually restart remote Splunk instances.
choices.C: Allows management of remote Splunk instances, requires no license, handles job of sending configurations, can automatically restart remote Splunk instances.
choices.B: Allows management of remote Splunk instances, requires Enterprise license, handles job of sending configurations, can automatically restart remote Splunk instances.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an appropriate description of a deployment server in a non-cluster environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. Please check System Administrator official Splunk Course Slide 259. 
"Universal Forwarders (UF)
• Gathers data from a host
• Sends data over the network to receiving
ports on receivers (usually an indexer)
• Provided as separate installation binary with
a built-in license (no limits)
• Designed to run on production servers
(minimal CPU / memory use, bandwidth constrained
to 256 KBps by default, no web interface, cannot
search or index)"

Selected Answer: B
Universal forwarders have no license, they also don't transform any data. All data is sent directly to the indexer. Heavy Forwarders, on the other hand, require a licence, and when purchased it is inbuilt, oc.

Selected Answer: B
Should be Heavy forwarder, forwarder license Sets the server up as a heavy forwarder, allowing authentication but no indexing

questions.question_text: Which Splunk forwarder has a built-in license?
What happens when the same username exists in Splunk as well as through LDAP?

choices.A: Splunk user is automatically deleted from authentication.conf.
choices.D: LDAP user is automatically deleted from authentication.conf.

discussion.content: C is correct. Splunk platform attempts native authentication first. If authentication fails outside of a local account that doesn't exist, there is no attempt to use LDAP to log in. This is adapted from precedence of Splunk authentication schema.
